column5:
Correct pos is limit over (21M) at condition file.
Sub Code : Alarm occurred conveyor condition file No
column7: Check the synchronized move at condition file, or check parameter auto cvque dis (SxE40). Correct pos is not updated after alarm is occurred, so Synchronized move is not done, and move at correct pos at alarm is occurred.
If the alarm occurs again, save the CMOS.BIN, and then contact your YASKAWA representative about occurrence status (operating procedure).

column3:
The conveyor position counter pulse
overflow
column5:
Curr pos is over at condition file.
Sub Code : Alarm occurred conveyor condition file No
column7: Check the POS RESOLUTION or synchronized move at condition file. Correct pos is not updated after alarm is occurred, so Synchronized move is not done, and move at correct pos at alarm is occurred.
If the alarm occurs again, save the CMOS.BIN, and then contact your YASKAWA representative about occurrence status (operating procedure).

column3: The setting of CONVEYOR CONDITION SUPPORT FILE is not correct.
column7: Check the settings for LS and shift distance in the conveyor condition support file. If the same LS is used, set the same shift disance in each condition file.
If the alarm occurs again, save the CMOS.BIN, and then contact your YASKAWA representative about occurrence status (operating procedure).

column3: The WORK IN/NOT shift data overflow
column7:
Check the shift data and the actual workpiece status.
If any inconsistency is found, delete the shift data and prepare newly the shift data.
If the alarm occurs again, save the CMOS.BIN, and then contact your YASKAWA representative about occurrence status (operating procedure).

If any inconsistency is found, delete the shift data and prepare newly the shift data.

If the alarm occurs again, save the CMOS.BIN, and then contact your YASKAWA representative about occurrence status (operating procedure).

Check the tracking area data in the synchronized section and the actual workpiece status.
If any inconsistency is found, delete the shift data in the synchronized section and prepare newly the shift
data.
If the alarm occurs again, save the CMOS.BIN, and then contact your YASKAWA representative about occurrence status (operating procedure).

column3:
The encoder was not in suspend status
when the control power supply was
turned ON.
column7:
Check the shift data and the actual workpiece status.
If any inconsistency is found, delete the shift data and prepare newly the shift data.
If the alarm occurs again, save the CMOS.BIN, and then contact your YASKAWA representative about occurrence status (operating procedure).

column2: TRACK AREA IN/NOT DATA POS LMT
column3:
The WORK IN/NOT data of the first
workpiece in the synchronized section
exceeds the preset value.
column7: Delete the WORK IN/NOT data in the synchronized section.
If the alarm occurs again, save the CMOS.BIN, and then contact your YASKAWA representative about occurrence status (operating procedure).

column2: TRACKING AREA ID DATA POS LMT

exceeds the preset value.

column3: An error occurred in the MIII communication of the NT112B board.
column5: There are slave stations with incomplete transmission delay time calculation.
column7:
(1)Turn the power OFF then back ON.
(2)If the alarm occurs again, replace the NT112B board. Save the CMOS.BIN before replace the board to be safe. Replace the NT112B board, and then load the CMOS.BIN saved before alarm occurred.
